alert.note: Alert for Burnet (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 21 at 6:35PM CDT until June 22 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following counties, Blanco, Burnet, Gillespie and Llano. * WHEN...Until 945 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 635 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fredericksburg, Kingsland, Llano, Blanco, Round Mountain, Gainesville, Granite Shoals, Horseshoe Bay, Johnson City, Stonewall, Highland Haven, Castell, Blowout, Willow City, Eckert, Oxford, Sandy, Enchanted Rock State Natural Area, Crabapple and LBJ State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
